books.title: Action Comics
books.general_commentary: Graded 78 by the Sotheby's Grading Commitee in 1992. A copy stolen from actor Nic Cage

books.title: All American Comics
books.grading_notes: qualified, coupon out of back cover

books.general_commentary: OS 27 reported $150,000 trade. To be honest, I'm only now including it for completeness' sake. First off, it's "trade" which you have to take with a grain of salt anyway. Secondly, if it's really VG/FN, then is it really a $100,000 book right now, no matter the pedigree?
books.title: Detective Comics
Marvel Comics
books.general_commentary: Listed variously as "NM" and "VF". Was part of a 25,000 cash/trade deal in 1990. $115,000 trade listed in OS27.

books.title: Marvel Comics
books.general_commentary: OS 20 Trade data- $108,000. John Verzyl said that this deal happened in 1984 and was for $132,000. Can I explain the discrepancy between what he says and the OS notation. No. Is it my job to make sure that all of the results reported here make sense? No (thankfully.) John did also verify the anecdote about this book. It is "perfect." There's nothing wrong with it. It's also supposedly got pretty nice registration.

books.title: Superman
books.general_commentary: Best Existing. The "Dentist's" copy. Grade range is 8.0-9.2. What we do know is that he had the option to have both this and the Church copy in hand and went with this one.

books.title: Whiz
books.general_commentary: Catalog NM+ Generally ranges from 9.0-9.8. OS 21 lists it as "MT." Changed hands in a cash/trade deal- $74,000 (1990)

books.title: Action Comics
books.general_commentary: Used in a lawsuit by DC against Fox.

books.title: Detective Comics
books.general_commentary: Of uncertain origin. Potentially two other books on this list (the FN68 copy or the 8.0 Mastro copy) or potentially a new copy.
